meanings.definition: A person who praises highly or enthusiastically.
meanings.sent1: The extollers cheered loudly for the talented singer.
meanings.sent2: The extollers at the concert were full of admiration for the performers.
meanings.sent3: The extollers' enthusiasm was contagious, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: Like shining stars in the sky, the extollers' praise illuminated the event.
meanings.sent5: The extollers' words of praise echoed in the room long after they had left.

meanings.sent1: She always extollers her favorite books to anyone who will listen.
meanings.sent2: The coach extollers the team for their hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: He extollers the virtues of eating vegetables with every meal.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter extollers through the room, bringing smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent5: The sun extollers its warmth upon the earth, bringing life to all living things.
